info.name: Oracle Fusion Cloud CX Sales - Access Group Extension Rules
info.description:
REST API collection for Oracle Fusion Cloud Sales and Service â€” Access Group Extension Rules module.

Created by [Adrian Anderson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aanderson1017/) | [YouTube - Better Human Applications](https://www.youtube.com/@BetterHumanApplications)

item.name: Access Group Extension Rules
Access Group Extension Rules/{AccExtRuleNumber}/Child/Access Group Extension Rule Details
Delete an access group extension rule detail

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

variable.description: (Required) The alternate key identifier for the access extension rule. It is a unique system generated sequence number.
(Required) The unique identifier of the access extension rule details.

response.name: No Content. This task does not return elements in the response body.

item.name: Get an access group extension rule detail

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AccExtRuleDetailId; integer; The unique identifier of the access extension rule details.
  • AccExtRuleId; integer; The unique identifier of the access extension rule.
  • AccExtRuleNumber; string; The alternate key identifier for the access extension rule. It is a unique system generated sequence number.
  • AccessGroupNumber; string; The alternate key identifier of the access group associated to the rule on the source object.
  • CreatedBy; string; The user who created the access extension rule.
  • CreationDate; string; The date when the access extension rule was created.
  • DeleteAccessPermissionFlag; boolean; Indicates whether delete access is granted.
  • DeleteFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the record can be deleted.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; The date when the access extension rule was last updated.
  • LastUpdateLogin; string; The login details of the user who last updated the access extension rule.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; The user who last updated the access extension rule.
  • ReadAccessPermissionFlag; boolean; Indicates whether read access is granted.
  • SrcObjAccessGroupId; integer; The unique identifier of the access group associated to the rule on the source object.
  • SrcObjectRuleGuid; string; The unique identifier of the rule on the source object.
  • SrcObjectRuleNumber; string; The alternate key identifier of the rule on the source object.
  • UpdateAccessPermissionFlag; boolean; Indicates whether update access is granted.
  • UpdateFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the record can be updated.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • AccessExtensionRuleDetailsRF: Finds an access group extension rule detail with the specified party number and access group number, access extension rule number and source object rule number.
    Finder Variables:
    • AccExtRuleNumber; string; The alternate key identifier for the parent access extension rule.
    • AccessGroupNumber; string; The alternate key identifier used to find the access group associated to the rule on the source object.
    • SrcObjectRuleNumber; string; The alternate key identifier of the rule on the source object used to find access extension rule details.
  • EXT_RULE_DETAILS_AK: Finds an access group extension rule detail with the specified primary key, rule guid, and access group Id.
    Finder Variables:
    • AccExtRuleId; integer; The unique identifier of the access group extension rule detail.
    • SrcObjAccessGroupId; integer; The unique identifier of the access group associated to the rule on the source object.
    • SrcObjectRuleGuid; string; The unique identifier of the rule on the source object.
  • PrimaryKey: The unique identifier of the access group extension rule detail.
    Finder Variables:
    • AccExtRuleDetailId; integer; The unique identifier of the access group extension rule detail.

item.name: Create an access group extension rule

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

response.name: The following table describes the default response for this task.

item.name: Get all access group extension rules

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AccExtRuleId; integer; The unique identifier of the access extension rule.
  • AccExtRuleNumber; string; The alternate key identifier for the access extension rule. It is a unique system generated sequence number.
  • ActiveFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the access extension rule is active or not.
  • CreatedBy; string; The user who created the access extension rule.
  • CreationDate; string; The date when the access extension rule was created.
  • DeleteFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the record can be deleted.
  • Description; string; The description of the access extension rule.
  • ExtendAllRulesFlag; boolean; Indicates the method used to identify which rules from the source object should be extended to the target object.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; The date when the access extension rule was last updated.
  • LastUpdateLogin; string; The login details of the user who last updated the access extension rule.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; The user who last updated the access extension rule.
  • Name; string; The name of the access extension rule.
  • PredefinedFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the access extension rule is predefined.
  • RelationshipDisplayName; string; The display name of the relationship between the source and target objects.
  • RelationshipId; integer; The unique identifier of the relationship between the source and target objects.
  • RelationshipName; string; The name of the relationship between the source and target objects.
  • RelationshipTypeCode; string; The type of the relationship between the source and target objects.
  • SourceObjectCode; string; The code of the source object used in the access extension rule.
  • SourceObjectName; string; The name of the source object used in the access extension rule.
  • TargetObjectCode; string; The code of the target object used in the access extension rule.
  • TargetObjectName; string; The name of the target object used in the access extension rule.
  • UpdateFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the record can be updated.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • ACC_EXT_RULES_AK: Finds an access group extension rule with the specified access group extension rule number.
    Finder Variables:
    • AccExtRuleNumber; string; The unique alternate identifier for the access group extension rule.
  • PrimaryKey: Finds an access group extension rule with the specified primary key.
    Finder Variables:
    • AccExtRuleId; integer; The unique identifier of the access group extension rule.

item.description: The access extension rules resource is used to view, create, update, and delete access extension rules. Access extension rules are used to extend the access defined for an object in an object sharing rule to a related object.
